revised_title: Growth Studies in Fossils: Taxonomy, Sexual Dimorphism, and Evolutionary Implications
tldr: This article discusses the importance of growth studies in fossils for understanding taxonomy, sexual dimorphism, and evolutionary implications. It explores various problems involving limited growth and seasonal growth, and highlights the significance of accurate growth studies in fossils for critical work. The author also presents examples of how growth studies can help in taxonomic and stratigraphical studies, and how they contribute to our understanding of the evolution of major groups of vertebrates.
